New Records: Nikola Jokic and Russell Westbrook became the first pair of teammates to record a triple-double in the same game twice in a single season.
Nikola Jokic and Russell Westbrook accomplished the feat of recording a 25-point triple-double in the same regular-season game.
Russell Westbrook recorded his 202nd career triple-double, which is the NBA record.
Key Match Events: Jokic returned to the game and had 9 points, 4 assists, and 3 rebounds in the fourth quarter after Brooklyn rallied to get within five.
Westbrook blocked Keon Johnson's shot with 6:51 left in the game after Jokic got his 10th rebound.
Pre-Game Insights: Denver coach Michael Malone praised the relationship between Jokic and Westbrook and the way the team supports each other.
Russell Westbrook credited Coach Michael Malone for giving him the freedom to play his game.
Post-Match Reflections: Nikola Jokic expressed that it's special and more important to win games than individual stats.
Russell Westbrook talked about bringing leadership, energy, and toughness to the team and that they're just getting started on figuring it out.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game resulted in a 124-105 win for the Denver Nuggets over the Brooklyn Nets.
